poem:
**Eternal Frequencies**

In Brisbane's heart, a pulse resounds,  
a voice unbridled, undeterred by strands  
of time, or bars of iron clad.  
14th of December, a date recalled,  
when walls were seized but not the sound;  
justice threaded through the airwaves,  
a choir against the static hum,  
where history's echoes burn brightly.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "4ZZZ community radio station celebrates 50 years of being Brisbane’s ‘voice against injustice and bullshit’ Every wall is like a history book. One faded poster reads “4ZZZ survives the 14th of December 88”, marking the date Queensland’s longest-running community radio station was evicted from the University of Queensland, partly due to their radical politics. Station historian Heather Anderson says students stormed right back in to reoccupy the place and it barely went off air, though". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: 4ZZZ community radio station celebrates 50 years of being Brisbane’s ‘voice against injustice and bullshit’ Every wall is like a history book. One faded poster reads “4ZZZ survives the 14th of December 88”, marking the date Queensland’s longest-running community radio station was evicted from the University of Queensland, partly due to their radical politics. Station historian Heather Anderson says students stormed right back in to reoccupy the place and it barely went off air, though
